body:
In my sanbox-application (at github.com/iboard/revolve) I can reproduce it.
So I've tried to figure it out from scratch. Here my experience ... 

  1. `rails new dummy`
  2. `rails g controller TestController index`
  3. adding `gem haml` and  route `root :to => 'test_controller#index'`
  4. index.haml => `link_to 'test', root_path, :remote => true`
  5. index.js.erb => `alert("Hello from js.erb");`

So far things are fine. Now, call a coffee-script from the js.erb-template ...

  6. index.js.erb => `call_coffee();`
  7. assets/javascript/test_controller.js.coffee => `@call_coffe = () -> alert("Hello from coffee")`

Now, if `:layout => false` is not explicitly given ...

    _include_layout?(options)
    LOG options => {:prefixes=>["test_controller", "application"], :template=>"index", **:layout=>"layouts/application"**, :stream=>nil}

with my 'workaround' or :layout => false everything works as expected.
I'm kinda confused but hopefully this info will help.
